edu.calstatela.sawooope.gamestates

Class GameStateManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.calstatela.sawooope.gamestates.GameStateManager

  • public class GameStateManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Our Game Is made up of many GameStates. In order to keep track of which one we want to display on screen we can use a GameState Manager. The GameState Manager (gsm for short) keeps track of which GameState we are currently updating and drawing; and also passed any motion(touch, swipe, etc) input to the current GameState so it can be handled properly

    Also note that the GameState Manager uses the getState() (which takes in and integer as a parameter)to create instances of a GameState. Every GameState should be archived in the GameState Manager class as a "static final int". For example:

    • Menu is a GameState, archived as in int with the value 0
    • Testing is a GameState, archived as in int with the value 1

    Author:
    Benji
